channel.title: (Class Suggestion) The Remnant
channel.description:
# [color=green]The Remnant (Neutral Wildcard)[/color]
Passive Ability: Immune to Occupy
**Day Ability 1: Expose (1 use)** Your target's Class will be revealed to the entire court
**Night Ability 1: Tamper** [details=If your Target is an _**Investigative**_ - ]Results will be wrong An example would be **Observer** seeing the wrong people visit[/details] - [details=If your Target is a **_Social_** -] They can't speak during the day They will be notified at the beginning of the day[/details] - [details=If your Target is a **_Killer_** - ] **Prince** will be forced to execute
**Paladin**, **Assassin**, **Knight** and **Reaper** will go to somebody at random (Not including you or themselves)
**Possessor** - They will go on as normal but if you were their target, you will survive[/details] - [details=If your Target is **_Offensive_** - ]**Butler/Servant** - (If able to) Forced to Poison King's Wine OR Will Serve to somebody at random
**Enforcer** - Will be forced to protect you
**Herbalist** - Will be forced to target somebody at random with Drug
**Invoker** - Will be forced to target somebody at random with Chains
**Sage** - Will be forced to target somebody at random with Shock[/details] - [details=If your Target is **_Support_** - ]**Alchemist** - Will be forced to heal you
**Court Wizard** - Will be forced to target somebody at random with Ice Ward
**Mercenary, Sellsword** - Will kill a player at random
**Physician** - Will be forced to heal you
**Ritualist, Soulcatcher, Priest** - Will be occupied[/details] - [details=If your Target is **_Special/Wildcard_** - ]**Fool** - Will be forced to target somebody at random with Fireworks
**Cult Leader/Mastermind** - Will be forced to target a player who is Convertable[/details]
(Maybe?) **The King** - During the day, if the King votes Execute or Pardon, it will instantly be treated as if he used Decide Fate
**Goal** _**Live to see Blue Dragon and The Unseen be defeated (Win with other Neutrals)**_
**Lore**
_Long ago, there was a Young Prince who excelled at his job at bringing justice to The Unseen. Late one night, he was paid a visit by The Unseen Mastermind. After hours of back and forth battling, the Mastermind managed to get into his mind. The Young Prince succumbed to the Mastermind and gave him his loyalty._
_This was the only record of a Prince ever being converted over to The Unseen. Huge precautions were taken after that. After years of service to The Unseen, he was soon promoted to Mastermind. However, his ties with The Blue Dragon made him very risky to keep around. Many of The Unseen were jealous that a young man such as the former Prince were given such a high ranking._
_During one of the nights, the Young Mastermind paid a visit to the Blue Dragon Sheriff to attempt a conversion, but he saw through the Young Mastermind and saw his true self. He saw the man he was before, the Young Prince. The Sheriff took his sword and attempted to cut him down but the Young Mastermind escaped, barely. He retreated back to The Unseen hideout to report his failure. He was banished._
_A former Prince. A former Mastermind. The Remnant was said to have been one of the only Princes and Masterminds who had lost their way. A failed Blue Dragon and a failed Unseen. All he could think of now was to see them all burn._

Made some changes

item.title: (Class Suggestion) The Remnant
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
All in all, this class wants both sides to suffer.

Forcing the Mastermind to convert means one less BD, but that also means a higher chance for them to be discovered.

A lot of the abilities here would be to cause utter chaos.

People get hung for bad reasons, and this creates them.

Sheriff said he found Unseen but was Blue Dragon? Is he fake?
Princess said this person was not BD but he’s BD? Execute her?
Observer gave wrong results? Clearly evil?

Same for not talkers… people get executed for not talking.

Butler says he served wine to 3, but 8 was Occupied? Liar?

Prince executing wasn’t something I was fond of writing I’m not decided on that myself

The role is 100% Neutral. Only wants himself to win, but can win with Reaper/Possessor. So it gives those two roles more control should they be in the same game.
